meanings.definition: The frame or main structure of a vehicle, on which the body is mounted.
meanings.sent1: The chassis of the car provides the strong foundation for the entire vehicle.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic inspected the chassis to ensure it was in good condition.
meanings.sent3: When the chassis of the truck started singing, everyone was surprised by its musical talent.
meanings.sent4: The chassis of the bicycle was like the backbone, giving it strength and stability.
meanings.sent5: The chassis, like a skeleton, holds everything together in a car.

meanings.definition: The base frame of a piece of machinery or electronic device.
meanings.sent1: Make sure to secure the chassis of the computer before installing any components.
meanings.sent2: The chassis of the generator was made of durable metal to withstand heavy use.
meanings.sent3: The chassis of the robot decided to take a break and refused to move an inch.
meanings.sent4: The chassis of the device was the sturdy foundation on which all other parts were attached.
meanings.sent5: The chassis, like a platform, held all the important parts together in the machine.

meanings.definition: The supporting frame or structure for a system or equipment.
meanings.sent1: The chassis of the air conditioning unit kept the entire system stable.
meanings.sent2: The technician reinforced the chassis of the server rack to prevent any accidents.
meanings.sent3: The chassis of the projector suddenly decided to moonwalk, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: The chassis of the equipment acted as a reliable backbone for the entire setup.
meanings.sent5: The chassis, like a guardian, protected the inner workings of the machinery.
